body_content.explanation: bad feelings between people because of things that happened in the past:
examples: The feud between the sisters resulted in decades of ill will that lasted their whole lives.
We may have once been competitors, but there's no ill will between us.
I hold no ill will towards him, though he's hurt me deeply.
I'm beginning to understand why people harbour such ill will against her - her behaviour is ghastly.

body_content.explanation: to be angry with someone because of something they have done:
examples: I bear him no ill will.
